conclusion: To determine the position of the particle on the x-axis at t = 8 s, analyze the velocity-time graph and integrate the velocity to find the position as a function of time.
From t = 0 to t = 1 s: The particle is moving with a constant positive velocity of 2 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_1 = v_1 ⋅ t_1 = 2 ⋅ 1 = 2 m.
Position at t = 1 s: x(1) = 5 + 2 = 7 m.
From t = 1 s to t = 3 s: The particle is moving with a constant positive velocity of 2 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_2 = v_2 ⋅ t_2 = 2 ⋅ 2 = 4 m.
Position at t = 3 s: x(3) = 7 + 4 = 11 m.
From t = 3 s to t = 4 s: The particle is moving with a constant negative velocity of 2 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_3 = v_3 ⋅ t_3 = -2 ⋅ 1 = -2 m.
Position at t = 4 s: x(4) = 11 - 2 = 9 m.
From t = 4 s to t = 5 s: The particle is moving with a constant negative velocity of 1 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_4 = v_4 ⋅ t_4 = -1 ⋅ 1 = -1 m.
Position at t = 5 s: x(5) = 9 - 1 = 8 m.
From t = 5 s to t = 7 s: The particle is moving with a constant negative velocity of 1 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_5 = v_5 ⋅ t_5 = -1 ⋅ 2 = -2 m.
Position at t = 7 s: x(7) = 8 - 2 = 6 m.
From t = 7 s to t = 8 s: The particle is moving with a constant positive velocity of 1 m/s.
Displacement in this segment: Δx_6 = v_6 ⋅ t_6 = 1 ⋅ 1 = 1 m.
